data.title: At The Eleventh Hour
data.meta_description: I read on this forum some years ago that two epsode sof this satire show were still in existance. Does anyone know the tx dates for these epsodes?  (I'm trying to find out which if any of the Ray
data.text:
Post by Adam James Smith on

I read on this forum some years ago that two epsode sof this satire show were still in existance. Does anyone know the tx dates for these epsodes? (I'm trying to find out which if any of the Ray Davies songs writtne for the series till exist!)

Post by Ray Langstone (was saintsray) on

I have to giggle for a lot of reasons....obviously, my burn-out is only affeting me 80%, and I'm resurrecting an olf thread from 8 years ago, when I'd never heard of the Forum....but....

These are the missing ones:-

"Missing or incomplete episodes for programme AT THE ELEVENTH HOUR.

30.12.67 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold (missing)

13.01.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold (missing)

20.01.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold (missing)

27.01.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold, Horace James, George Webb (missing)

10.02.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Horace James, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, George Webb, The Scaffold (missing)

24.02.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold (missing)

02.03.68 with Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes, Roger McGough, Richard Neville, Alan Shallcross, The Scaffold (missing)

Out of an original total of 9 episodes, 7 episodes are missing."

And this is a small excerpt at the BBC:-

""

Broadcast:

21/01/68

Title:

TALKBACK

Description:

Feedback programme from television viewers, introduced by David COLEMAN. Discussion concerns the quiz programme 'So You Think You Know What's Happening' and possible blasphemy and anti-Semitism on 'At The Eleventh Hour'

>film, vt inserts, ex libAT THE ELEVENTH HOUR, two sketches are debated in relation to blasphemy and anti-Semitism cont. excerpt from At The Eleventh Hour, from 20.01.68 with Christopher HAYTHORN and Larry ADLE R

Duration:

00:35:00.000+01:00""

Post by krssweet on

The latest find by myself for Kaleidoscope is the audio only for seven lost episodes of "At The Eleventh Hour" a BBC satirical TV show from 1968.

The show combined a review of the week's news with comedy, music & poetry

The Cast Included Jeannie Lambe, Miriam Margolyes and Richard Neville and The Scaffold. Jeannie Lamb would perform a song each week especially written by Ray Davis of the Kinks. Roger McGough contributed a topical poem as well as sketches by the Scaffold.

The episodes recovered are:

30.12.1967

06.01.1968

13.01.1968

20.01.1968

27.01.1968

03.02.1968

10.02.1968

All are in extremely good condition and are a direct line recording

Post by Christopher Perry on

Extracts will be on our next Podcast, the BBC have copies and we will be showing the only surviving actual picture/sound clip at our event on the 5th April 2014.

I suggest you look at www.kaleidoscopearchive.co.uk or www.kaleidoscopepublishing.co.uk

or join our Facebook group.

Thanks

Chris
